alert.note: Alert for Bennington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 12:39PM EST until January 14 at 1:30PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Eastern Warren County in east central New York... Northeastern Saratoga County in east central New York... Washington County in east central New York... Northwestern Bennington County in southern Vermont... * Until 130 PM EST. * At 1239 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from Huletts Landing to near Corinth, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes Interstate 87 between exits 17S and 22. Locations impacted include... Glens Falls, Hudson Falls, Whitehall, Lake George Village, Fort Edward, Corinth, Granville, Hartford, Hague, Comstock, Bolton Landing, Glens Falls North, Rogers Rock Campground, West Glens Falls, Huletts Landing, Lake Luzerne-Hadley, Putnam, Queensbury, Kingsbury, and Mount Hope. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
